title: internal compiler error: librustc_mir/transform/elaborate_drops.rs — drop of untracked, uninitialized value

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-mentor
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue has a mentor. Use RustcContributor::new on Zulip for discussion.

labels.name: NLL-sound
labels.description: Working towards the "invalid code does not compile" goal

milestone.title: NLL: Valid code works
milestone.description: Fix all known ICEs or other cases where code that *ought* to compile does not

body:
**UPDATE:** Mentoring instructions [can be found here](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/48962#issuecomment-374402215)

---

```rust
#![feature(nll)]

struct Node {
    elem: i32,
    next: Option<Box<Node>>,
}

fn main() {
    let mut node = Node {
        elem: 5,
        next: None,
    };

    let mut src = &mut node;
    while let Some(node) = {src}.next.as_mut().map(|node| &mut *node) {
        src = node;
    }
    src.next = None;
}
```

```
$ RUST_BACKTRACE=1 rustc +nightly a.rs
warning: field is never used: `elem`
 --> a.rs:4:5
  |
4 |     elem: i32,
  |     ^^^^^^^^^
  |
  = note: #[warn(dead_code)] on by default

error: internal compiler error: librustc_mir/transform/elaborate_drops.rs:384: drop of untracked, uninitialized value bb7, place ((*_3).1: std::option::Option<std::boxed::Box<Node>>) (Parent(Some(mp3)))
  --> a.rs:18:5
   |
18 |     src.next = None;
   |     ^^^^^^^^

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', librustc_errors/lib.rs:482:9
note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace.
stack backtrace:

  19: rustc::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task_impl

  21: rustc::ty::maps::<impl rustc::ty::maps::queries::optimized_mir<'tcx>>::try_get
  22: rustc::ty::maps::TyCtxtAt::optimized_mir

  32: rustc_trans::base::trans_crate

  38: rustc_driver::run_compiler

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.26.0-nightly (2789b067d 2018-03-06) running on x86_64-apple-darwin
```
